app

You could first determine the mean and standard deviation of the Bernoulli variable \(X\).

\[\mu = p = 0.37\] \[\sigma = \sqrt{p(1-p)} = 0.482804\]


  1. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.4028\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}= \sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} = 0.080467\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.41\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<0.41)=0.6591\)
  2. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=33.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =4.3452\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=0.81\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z<0.81)=0.791\)
  3. Identify the boundary.\[\hat{p}=0.345\]Calculate the standard error (of proportion sampling)\[\text{SE} = \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}=\sqrt{\frac{p(1-p)}{n}} =0.04828\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\hat{p}-\mu}{\text{SE}}=-0.52\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>-0.52)=0.6985\)
  4. Identify the boundary.\[\sum x=14.5\]Calculate the standard error (of total)\[\text{SE} = \sigma\sqrt{n}=\sqrt{np(1-p)} =3.3796\]Get the z score.\[z=\frac{\sum x-n\mu}{\text{SE}}=-1.07\]With \(z\)-table, determine \(P(Z>-1.07)=0.8577\)
